questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the GET VPN components from the left onto the correct descriptions on the right.

//IMG//
Which two tasks must be performed to implement a clientless VPN on the Cisco ASA? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Correct answer is C.
The bookmark is applied under the web vpn subconfiguration mode of the group policy.

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C

"C" appears to be right answer. To make a bookmark or URL list available for clientless SSLVPN users on a Cisco ASA, it needs to be configured under the "webvpn (group-policy)" section. The "webvpn (group-policy)" configuration is specific to a particular group policy on the Cisco ASA. By configuring the bookmark or URL list under the appropriate group policy, you can control which clientless SSLVPN users have access to specific bookmarks or URLs. The "webvpn (global configuration)" section, on the other hand, is used for global configuration settings that apply to all clientless SSLVPN users. It defines the overall behavior and settings of the SSLVPN functionality on the Cisco ASA but does not handle the specific bookmarks or URL lists. Therefore, to make a bookmark or URL list available for clientless SSLVPN users, ensure that it is configured under the relevant group policy within the "webvpn (group-policy)" section.

Selected Answer: C
You can specify a list of URLs to appear on the clientless SSL VPN home page for a group policy. First, you must create one or more named lists by entering the url-list command in global configuration mode. To apply a list of servers and URLs for clientless SSL VPN sessions to a particular group policy, allowing access to the URLs in a list for a specific group policy, use the name of the list or lists you create there with the url-list command in group-policy webvpn configuration mode. There is no default URL list.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa97/configuration/vpn/asa-97-vpn-config/webvpn-configure-policy-groups.html#ID-2439-00001484

Answer C is correct.
Apply a URL List:
You can specify a list of URLs to appear on the clientless SSL VPN home page for a group policy. First, you must create one or more named lists by entering the url-list command in global configuration mode. To apply a list of servers and URLs for clientless SSL VPN sessions to a particular group policy, allowing access to the URLs in a list for a specific group policy, use the name of the list or lists you create there with the url-list command in group-policy webvpn configuration mode. There is no default URL list.

The following example sets a URL list called FirstGroupURLs for the group policy named FirstGroup and specifies that this should be the first URL list displayed on the homepage:
hostname(config)# group-policy FirstGroup attributes
hostname(config-group-policy)# webvpn 
hostname(config-group-webvpn)# url-list value FirstGroupURLs 1
hostname(config-group-webvpn)#

Selected Answer: C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa97/configuration/vpn/asa-97-vpn-config/webvpn-configure-policy-groups.html says clearly:
In group-policy webvpn configuration mode, you can specify (list of things, including url-list).

I think C , i have configured list called test in ASA ASDM, the configuration as below:
 import webvpn url-list test disk0:/tmpAsdmImportFile94134984
 delete /noconfirm disk0:/tmpAsdmImportFile94134984
 group-policy "GroupPolicy_SSL-Clientless" attributes
 webvpn
 url-list value test
 exit
 group-policy "GroupPolicy_SSL-Clientless" attributes
 no vpn-simultaneous-login-delete-no-delay
 exit
so its under WEBVPN group policy

C is the Correct option

(Optional) Assign bookmarks to a specific group policy.
Choose Configuration > Remote Access VPN > Clientless SSL VPN Access > Group Policies > Edit > Portal > Bookmark List.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security-vpn/webvpn-ssl-vpn/119417-config-asa-00.html

i belive its D

Under my link you can see, that the url-list needs to be imported and then you can connect it to a group-policy

https://www.danpol.net/old-danpol/files/3113/6456/3258/asa-sslvpn-clientless-13.PNG

some years later i know its C

cli:
group-policy Grp-Management attributes
 webvpn
 url-list value Bookmark-Management

asdm:
Configuration > Remote Access VPN > Clientless SSL VPN Access > Group Policies > Portal > Bookmark List

discussion.content: the correct answer should be C

questions.question_text: Under which section must a bookmark or URL list be configured on a Cisco ASA to be available for clientless SSLVPN users?

choices.C: crypto vpn anyconnect profile SSL_profile flash:simos-profile.xml

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct one, checked on Cisco website
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/anyconnect-secure-mobility-client/200533-AnyConnect-Configure-Basic-SSLVPN-for-I.html

comments.content:
I disagree because of two points, point 1, the option A shows ARD (Apple Remote Desktop) which will discard it immediately and not ERD. 

Second, ERD is the functionality as it appears in the portal, but not the Java applet itself, the Java applet is RDP2

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
the answer is ERD and VNC

questions.question_text: Which two Java-based components for web browsers in clientless SSL VPN sessions are distributed by Cisco? (Choose two.)
